body_html:
@csarofeen @SsnL
That is why cudnn and non-cudnn LSTM is Type 2 in my figure.

Outputs of forward and backward layer are concatenated after each bidirectional layer.
When the first forward layer output is 3 and backward output is 3, the input vector of the second layer is 6.

This type 2 LSTM is usually used for classification work.
But it doesn't work for language modeling because the label of input word should be unknown.

I think if you support type 1 LSTM, many researcher in language can be happy ^^

Thank you.
